author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Big bugs rule Saltwater screen
text:
Big bugs rule Saltwater screen Oct 08, 2015 “Them” (1954, USA) is considered one of the best science fiction films of the 1950s and the start of that era of nuclear anxiety’s giant insect genre. 
Thomaston — This month's Saltwater Film Society screening is set for the third Thursday of the month, Oct. 15, at 7 p.m. in Thomaston Public Library’s room 200 in the Thomaston Academy building, 60 Main St./Route 1. Parking and handicapped accessible entrance is at rear of the building. 
This Halloween month, attendees should prepare to have see endoskeletons turned into shaking pools of radioactive waste, thanks to the 1954 horror classic “Them.” This film has everything — nuclear holocaust, giant man-eating ants, mile-deep catacombs and, if you watch carefully, a very early appearance by Leonard Nimoy. A film discussion will follow. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
